fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Consumers, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Encourage “cloud first” public procurement policy initiatives with a “comply or explain” requirement when costlier onsite proprietary computing is preferred over cloud infrastructures 
 
Promote coherent EU-wide security requirements and international technical security standards across all Member States 
 
Support IaaS specific cloud privacy requirements, including through a privacy Code of Conduct for Infrastructure providers 
 
Keep the EU cloud infrastructure market open, competitive and free from “lock-in” in single proprietary technologies or services 
 
Ensure that the EU legal framework takes due account of the particular features of IaaS cloud computing
organisation_name: CLOUD INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICES PROVIDERS IN EUROPE (CISPE)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Public Procurement 
Network and Information security 
Data Privacy 
E-commerce and Internet-related legislation and policies 
IoT/5G, ICT-related policies and standardisation 
Data Economy 
Free flows of data
goals__remit: CISPE advocates for the creation of the cloud infrastructure single market to harness the power of IaaS and achieve Europe’s ambitious employment and growth goals.
